intro: Allosorus scaberulus, commonly known as the rough allosorus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features finely divided, serrated leaves that are covered in a rough, hairy texture, giving it its common name. Its small, white flowers are arranged in compound umbels, a typical feature of the carrot family. Allosorus scaberulus is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and soil stability.
